text:
Hi everyone,
Using freelopers theme (delight), I need to do some css modifications but I don’t know where/how can I access to the css file and I need to add module from other theme. Could someone help me please ?
Regards.

Hi,

Not sure if this is possible but I have a situation where I'm using one theme to build two different websites within one portal.

Each website runs via a different 'branded domain'. The theme has global partials to set up headers and footers. There's an issue where the header gets shared across each domain but I need each domain to get a different one.

Does anyone know if this is possible, to have different global modules / partials for each domain?

Thanks for your help!
David
You have to duplicate the theme.

Hi Chad, thanks for getting back so quickly!

Good idea but I think there might be an issue with this approach as I've already built the pages using the theme.

If I clone the theme I'm pretty sure I would have to rebuild them because the templates will have changed? Do you know if this is correct?

Thanks!
Yeah.. that will be an issue.

In your theme does the settings for the head and footer get set on the module or in the theme 
settings
its in a module within a global partial
you can duplicate the module and change the settings there
I'll give that a go here and see what happens, thanks for your help Chad!
Hey Mike! Wanted to followup and let you know we are still seeing your theme submission in our admin view same  as before.

Hi <@U025C4J8MF1> you should create a child theme from that theme. That way you’ll be able to get updates the theme provider makes while adding your customizations. This feature is still in beta so feel free to send me your account ID and I’ll make sure you are all setup with it.
